intro: Orchis angustifolia subsp. pycnantha, commonly known as narrow-leaved orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Europe. It is a perennial herb with a slender, leafy stem that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces a single, spike-like inflorescence bearing numerous small, greenish-yellow flowers with distinctive lip petals. Its leaves are linear and narrow, often arranged in a rosette at the base. This subspecies is adapted to calcareous soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
